abstract: The ratings agency lowers its outlook for Warren E. Buffett’s company and four other insurers, citing the downgrade on United States debt.
snippet: The ratings agency lowers its outlook for Warren E. Buffett’s company and four other insurers, citing the downgrade on United States debt.
lead_paragraph: Not long after Berkshire Hathaway uncharacteristically entered the takeover fray for Transatlantic Holdings, offering $3.25 billion, the credit ratings agency Standard & Poor’s had a surprise of its own: It lowered its outlook on Warren E. Buffett‘s company.
